Author: John Grisham
Description: A decorated World War II veteran shoots and kills a pastor inside a Mississippi church.
Title: THE RECKONING

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Description: Difficult choices surface when Hope Anderson and Tru Walls meet in a North Carolina seaside town.
Title: EVERY BREATH

Author: George RR Martin
Description: Set 300 years before the events of “A Game of Thrones,” this is the first volume of the two-part history of the Targaryens in Westeros.
Title: FIRE AND BLOOD

Author: Delia Owens
Description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.
Title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING

Author: James Patterson
Description: Alex Cross returns for the 26th book in the series bearing his name.
Title: TARGET: ALEX CROSS

Author: W Bruce Cameron
Description: A dog sets out across 400 miles of wilderness to find the man who rescued her as a puppy.
Title: A DOG'S WAY HOME

Author: Lee Child
Description: Jack Reacher explores the New England town where his father was born and a Canadian couple now find themselves stranded.
Title: PAST TENSE

Author: Heather Morris
Description: A concentration camp detainee tasked with permanently marking fellow prisoners falls in love with one of them.
Title: THE TATTOOIST OF AUSCHWITZ

Author: David Baldacci
Description: Atlee Pine, an F.B.I. agent who is haunted by the childhood kidnapping of her twin sister, must choose between protecting her career or the United States' democracy.
Title: LONG ROAD TO MERCY

Author: Liane Moriarty
Description: A romance writer becomes fascinated by the owner and director of a health resort.
Title: NINE PERFECT STRANGERS

Author: Mitch Albom
Description: The sequel to "The Five People You Meet in Heaven" follows Annie on her heavenly journey.
Title: THE NEXT PERSON YOU MEET IN HEAVEN

Author: Fern Michaels
Description: Isabelle Flanders Tookus calls on a group of women known as the Sisterhood to save a millionaire's genius grandson.
Title: SAFE AND SOUND

Author: Rupi Kaur
Description: Poetic approaches to surviving adversity and loss.
Title: MILK AND HONEY

Author: Stephen King
Description: A man who is losing weight without getting thinner forms an unlikely alliance with his neighbors who are dealing with prejudices.
Title: ELEVATION

Author: Marc Cameron
Description: President Jack Ryan must contain the fallout of a flu epidemic, an undermining senator and two hijacked Russian nuclear missiles.
Title: TOM CLANCY: OATH OF OFFICE

Author: Michelle Obama
Description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
Title: BECOMING

Author: Charles Krauthammer,
Description: A collection of essays, speeches and unpublished writings by the late conservative columnist.
Title: THE POINT OF IT ALL

Author: Tara Westover
Description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
Title: EDUCATED

Author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
Description: A look at the postwar manhunt for members of Hitler’s inner circle.
Title: KILLING THE SS

Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.
Title: SAPIENS

Author: Pete Souza
Description: The former White House photographer juxtaposes pictures of former President Obama with tweets, headlines and quotes from the Trump administration.
Title: SHADE

Author: Doris Kearns Goodwin
Description: The challenges that shaped the leadership abilities of four presidents: Abraham Lincoln, Theodore Roosevelt, Franklin D. Roosevelt and Lyndon B. Johnson.
Title: LEADERSHIP

Author: Andrew Roberts
Description: A biography focusing on what motivated the war leader and how he learned from his mistakes.
Title: CHURCHILL: WALKING WITH DESTINY

Author: Stephen Hawking
Description: A collection of essays from the late scientist’s personal archive that address 10 imponderables.
Title: BRIEF ANSWERS TO THE BIG QUESTIONS

Author: Michael Diamond and Adam Horovitz
Description: The story of the New York band who achieved hip hop stardom.
Title: BEASTIE BOYS BOOK

Author: Bob Woodward
Description: Based on hours of interviews with sources, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist describes debates and decision-making within the Trump White House.
Title: FEAR

Author: Tucker Carlson
Description: The Fox News anchor argues that America’s ruling class is out of touch with everyday citizens.
Title: SHIP OF FOOLS

Author: Michael Lewis
Description: The author of "The Big Short" examines how the Trump administration staffs its federal agencies.
Title: THE FIFTH RISK

Author: Pete Souza
Description: More than 300 pictures of the former president by his White House photographer, with behind-the-scenes stories.
Title: OBAMA

Author: John Carreyrou
Description: The rise and fall of Theranos, the biotech startup that failed to deliver on its promise to make blood testing more efficient.
Title: BAD BLOOD

Author: Stephen King
Description: A detective investigates a seemingly wholesome member of the community when an 11-year-old boy’s body is found.
Title: THE OUTSIDER

Author: Louise Penny
Description: While on suspension, Chief Inspector Armand Gamache is made an executor of a stranger’s will and tries to keep a deadly narcotic off Montreal’s streets.
Title: KINGDOM OF THE BLIND

Description: President Jonathan Duncan takes on adversaries at home and abroad.
Title: THE PRESIDENT IS MISSING

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Description: A straightforward, easy-to-understand introduction to the universe.
Title: ASTROPHYSICS FOR PEOPLE IN A HURRY

Author: Kobe Bryant
Description: The former Los Angeles Lakers player describes various skills and techniques he used.
Title: THE MAMBA MENTALITY

Author: Heather Morris

Title: THE TATTOOIST OF AUSCHWITZ

Author: Rupi Kaur
Description: A collection of poetry about love, loss, trauma and healing.
Title: MILK AND HONEY

Author: Kevin Kwan
Description: A New Yorker gets a surprise when she spends the summer with her boyfriend in Singapore.
Title: CRAZY RICH ASIANS

Author: Gail Honeyman
Description: A young woman’s well-ordered life is disrupted by the I.T. guy from her office.
Title: ELEANOR OLIPHANT IS COMPLETELY FINE

Author: Rupi Kaur
Description: A second collection of poetry from the author of "Milk and Honey."
Title: THE SUN AND HER FLOWERS

Author: Josie Silver
Description: A woman spends a year searching for a man in London she believes — after a single glance — is her true love.
Title: ONE DAY IN DECEMBER

Author: Anthony Doerr
Description: The lives of a blind French girl and a gadget-obsessed German boy before and during World War II.
Title: ALL THE LIGHT WE CANNOT SEE

Author: Kristin Hannah
Description: Two sisters in World War II France: one struggling to survive in the countryside, the other joining the Resistance.
Title: THE NIGHTINGALE

Author: Andrew Sean Greer
Description: Winner of the 2018 Pulitzer Prize in fiction. To avoid an ex-boyfriend's wedding, a failed novelist attends literary events around the world.
Title: LESS

Author: Kevin Kwan
Description: The second book in the Crazy Rich Asians trilogy. As her wedding draws near, Rachel Chu discovers her birth father.
Title: CHINA RICH GIRLFRIEND

Author: Kate Quinn
Description: A pregnant American college student and a French spy join together on a mission in London in 1947.
Title: THE ALICE NETWORK

Author: Ruth Ware
Description: A travel writer on a cruise is certain she has heard a body thrown overboard, but no one believes her.
Title: THE WOMAN IN CABIN 10

Author: Min Jin Lee
Description: In the early 20th century, a Korean fisherman's daughter has a wealthy stranger's child, marries a pastor and moves to Japan.
Title: PACHINKO

Author: Greer Hendricks and Sarah Pekkanen
Description: The story of a love triangle is told from several points of view.
Title: THE WIFE BETWEEN US
